Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2010 08:12AM paml wrote: We are all here for you Frankie! Had a follow up on Monday and the onc. says everything looks great. He did say he was sending off the blood samples for more testing and he wouldn't call if everything looked fine. I am with you girl, every time that phone rings, I jump.  Let us know how things are going. This disease stinks!
Posts.Title: I'am going CRAZY!!! Frankie_ FireKracker

Posts.Content: paml wrote: Hi Everyone! I finished chemo and rads in July and recently went for my 3 month checkup August then again in the early part of January. My oncologist did the usual blood test, talked to me for a few minutes and said, "Everything looks good. Ill see you in 6 months."  I said, "Are you sure?" I have a high chance of recurrence plus I have Stage 3 cancer!" He did not even check my mastectomy scar. His reply was. " Yes, your chance of survival is just as good as anyone else's. When I got home, I thought about this and became extremely angry! Isn't everyone suppose to have a 3 months checkup at least for the first 2 years when the chance of recurrence is the greatest? I feel like I have been ignored once again! Would you guys pick another oncologist if you were me? Please let me know what you think? I think 6 months is too long to wait! thanks for you advice! Dx 12/12/2008, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 2/9 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Are You Sure? paml diana50

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2010 08:29AM paml wrote: ahh Kimber You are not alone. I have had several breakdowns myself. For some reason, its always in the rad oncologist office. I feel that this fear will never leave us. Sending you lots of hugs also. We are all here for you!

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2009 11:48PM paml wrote: Hi PurE I have been on the stage 3 thread for a couple of months but havent really posted much lately. Today marks my 1 year anniversary since my mastectomy and I noticed that you and I are the only stage 3 B. Was wondering if you could share your stats with me because I really don't see alot of 3B girls. Mine( 5.5 cm/ 2 nodes positive, lobular carcinoma) It would be good to talk to another 3B girl. Hope to hear from you
Posts.Title: Venting..... Pure HairSprayMom

Posts.Content: paml wrote: Hi Everyone, I have been on the clinical trials and research forum and I was noticing that someone wrote in about the Mirena IUD. I had the mirena to prevent irregular bleeding and 8 months later, I had 3 cancerous tumors in my left breast. Some people were saying that they felt that the mirena contributed to their breast cancer. I thought I would bring this question over to the Stage 3 forum and see if there was anyone else out there who used the mirena and felt the same thing. If not the mirena, maybe you were using something else that you felt may have been a factor. Interested to know your responses. love, Pam Dx 12/12/2008, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 2/9 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The Mirena IUD paml paml

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2009 05:45PM paml wrote: Hi Michele I too have seen many women on this site with lots of positive nodes. Many seem to be doing well and living a long and happy life. Hang in there girl! We are all in this together!

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2010 04:10PM paml wrote: Hi Feroza, Glad to hear all your test went well. I had a port from January to August of this year. It is not bad at all and you can shower and do not need to do anything to it. It does leave a small scar but no so bad. Hang in there and I will  be thinking of you. We are all here if you need us.
Posts.Title: Our new girl needs some support! Let-It-Be dee1961

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2010 04:46PM paml wrote: Hi Pure, Wanted to begin by saying what a great person you are and how I have enjoyed seeing your pics of your beautiful family. Your post have made me feel so much better on days when I was down.As far as your test, I know how scary they are. Not sure if I am wrong, but I think the bone scans are to see if you have osteoporosis( at least that was the case for me) I had the PET scan and its not so bad. Have to sit there for a while. Then its over quickly. Sending you lots of hugs Pam
Posts.Title: Super Scared Pure Mamita49

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2010 11:25AM paml wrote: Hi Mimi Sorry you are having such a hard time with chemo. Some people seem to get through it alot easier than others. My doctor gave me a drug called Emend. One pill before the infusion. Then 1 each day for two days after the infusion. I was still sick but it didnt seem to be as bad. Experienced strange smells so I tried to stay out of the kitchen. Hang in there! Hugs, Pam

Posts.Title: Newbie here AzKim cherneski

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2010 07:31PM paml wrote: Hi Polyana, I am stage 3B like you which means that a tumor can be of any size but if it is found in the chest wall or under the skin, it is considered 3b. I had a double mastectomy with radiation to the effected side. I too had grade 2 which means medium aggressive. I am now taking femara daily and feel fine after being diagnosed 2 years ago. Hope this helps.

Posts.Title: CAN'T CATCH MY BREATH?????? jenn3 precioustime

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2009 02:23PM paml wrote: Hi Cheryl, I too know the feeling of not being able to sleep at night. I have found alot of comfort and support on this web sight and I hope you will continue to come here for support. I was just dx in Dec 08 and thought mine was a simple stage 1. Got my mammos every year. Was shocked to learn that I was actually a stage 3 with a 5.5 cm tumor plus 2 smaller tumors in same breast. Just returned from pre operative testing because I have decided to remove the right one on August 19th. I have read so many stories on this sight where women have had multiple lymph node involvement and have lived many years. This place is so encouraging!  Keep your chin up! Kerry Mac- I was wondering if you experienced any "small red dots " after rads! I have 2 and Im so scared its skin mets! See the rado next Wednesday! Sounds like your surgery went well! Pam
Posts.Title: moving over again..it just keeps.. victoriasecret Gitane

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2009 06:02PM paml wrote: Hi Karen,  I was dx 6 months before you so I am already done with the chemo and rads. Found chemo to be tougher than rads but thats just me. People react differently. Did get tired of smelling purell hand sanitizer! Do have one tip! Doctor told me to use plastic eating utensils! That way you won't get a metal taste in your mouth. Just like Karen, I couldn't drink water with chemo and everything had a bad odor! Takes a couple of days for symptoms to pass! Keep in touch and let us know how you are. We are all with you in this fight! Pam
